text: adding strawberries goat cheese and red
wine to cheesecake makes it lighter less
sweet and a heck of a lot more flavorful
plus a homemade graham cracker crust
gives you bragging rights
so most cheesecake recipes use graham
crackers that you buy in the store and
that's perfectly fine but if you make
your own graham cracker cookie dough it
just tastes so much better so in my bowl
I have whole wheat flour regular flour
and salt add a little bit of cinnamon
cinnamon is what makes it taste graham
crackery I'm also going to add a little
bit of cocoa I think it adds a nice
complexity and it also darkens the color
of the crust which is more attractive so
in my mixer I've got butter and brown
sugar I'm just gonna beat that until
it's creamy and then I'm gonna add my
dry ingredients I know I'm gonna add
honey
wrap up your dough we just want to form
it into a disk and it needs to chill in
the fridge for at least two hours or you
could even do this a couple of days
ahead if you want so now this is nice
and firm which is what you want and I'm
going to roll it out in between two
pieces of parchment instead of using
flour so it's great about using a cookie
dough for this is that it's a very
forgiving dough it's not like a pie
dough that's very delicate you have to
be careful with it lift up the whole
piece of parchment and then flop the
dough into the pan this is what we call
a crust comb over it's when I take
pieces from one side that have too much
and I put it on the other side that
doesn't quite have enough now I'm just
gonna prick it all over and then you
want this to chill in the fridge for
about 20 minutes so it firms up again as
you can see it got a little bit soft so
remember I mentioned the red wine well
what I'm gonna use it for is to bloom
the gelatin this is a no bake cheesecake
well except for the crust but I'm not
gonna bake the filling the filling is
really light and I set it with gelatin
so I've got my red wine here I've got my
gelatin here I'm just gonna sprinkle it
right on the top by the way try to use a
really bright and fruity red wine for
this because it'll just underscore the
strawberry flavor after about five
minutes the gelatin will be soft it will
have expanded into the liquid you can
see it looks kind of like sludge that's
what you're looking for then it's done
now I'm just gonna heat it up and that's
gonna melt the gelatin now you want to
do this gently you're not looking for
this to boil just want to melt it and
now for the filling enter the goat
cheese in this food processor I have
regular cream cheese goat cheese and
sugar
you want to get this cream-cheese
mixture really smooth before you add
anything else so I've got my
strawberries and just has to be cool
before you add it otherwise it's gonna
melt the cream cheese which would be
very bad
and then when it's smooth pour it into
the baked and cooled crust you'll notice
that the Cheesecake mixture is coming up
beyond the top of the crust and that's
gonna look really pretty when we unmold
it because we're gonna see the crust on
the bottom layer and the top is gonna be
pink and then you just need to chill
this in the fridge until it firms up at
least four to six hours so this is what
it looks like when it's all done it may
seem a little scary to take the
springform pan off so here are some
insurance policies just to make sure it
comes out perfectly take a hot wet dish
towel put it around and you just kind of
wipe and let it sit there for a few
seconds that helps soften and melt the
outer layer and it makes it detach from
the sides and then you just want to take
a paring knife run it around the sides
and then just very carefully unmold it
tada
you could service as it is but I'm gonna
put more strawberries on the top just to
make it extra pretty okay so this isn't
the easiest dessert in the world but the
beauty of it is that you can do the
entire thing ahead and then look what
you end up with
Oh
